New Records: Adil Rashid now has 90 T20I wickets, the joint most for an Englishman, level with Chris Jordan.
Sri Lanka's total of 141 for 8 was the lowest total posted first at the SCG in this competition.
England became the first team to win at the SCG when chasing.
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes scored 42* from 36 balls to guide England to victory.
Mark Wood took 3 wickets for 26 runs, including two in the 20th over.
Pathum Nissanka scored 67 off 45 balls for Sri Lanka.
Chris Woakes hit the winning boundary with two balls remaining.
Adil Rashid bowled 4 overs for 16 runs and took the wicket of Pathum Nissanka.
Lahiru Kumara bowled a crucial 18th over, conceding just 2 runs and taking the wicket of Sam Curran.
Post-Match Reflections: England are through to the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup, knocking Australia out in the process.
If Dawid Malan's injury is as feared, a batting replacement will have to be drafted in for the semi-final.
Buttler's charges now head to Adelaide for their semi-final.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch at the SCG slowed down, affecting the pace of the game.
England's collective attack used cutters and slower deliveries effectively on the worn surface.
